definition: UN convention against torture and cruel treatment (ratified by PRC in 1988)
pinyin: fan3 ku4 xing2 zhe2 mo2 gong1 yue1

sentences.english: The people who allowed torture have faced no punishment at all.
sentences.chinese: 而那些允许酷刑的人却不会受到任何处罚。

sentences.english: But you don't get it from torture.
sentences.chinese: 但你没法从酷刑中得到它。

sentences.english: Sources close to Tang Jitian say he has been severely tortured.
sentences.chinese: 接近唐吉田的消息人称唐吉田受到严重酷刑。

sentences.english: The psychological impact of CIDT and physical torture was almost indistinguishable.
sentences.chinese: CIDT和肉体上的酷刑对心理的重创几乎相同。

sentences.english: So this, really, is the problem with World of Warcraft's torture sequence.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这就是魔兽世界酷刑折磨的问题所在。

sentences.english: Tine says you cannot send someone to a country that practices torture and uses the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 梯纳还说，不能把人送往一个实行酷刑和死刑的国家。

sentences.english: It can't just mean torture at the hands of the state.
sentences.chinese: 它并不单单指，国家所实行的酷刑。

sentences.english: Teething shouldn't be an excruciating ordeal for a baby.
sentences.chinese: 因为长牙不应该是折磨宝宝的酷刑。

sentences.english: Zoya heroically bore the torture that the Fascists inflicted upon her.
sentences.chinese: 卓娅英勇地承受法西斯匪徒加在她身上的酷刑。

sentences.english: I don't have any torture stories to share.
sentences.chinese: 但我没有任何酷刑故事来和你们分享。

sentences.english: Are prisoners subjected to torture and ill-treatment?
sentences.chinese: 犯人有否受到酷刑和虐待？

sentences.english: Described someone as a eulogist of torture?
sentences.chinese: 谁把某个人描述成酷刑的歌颂者？

sentences.english: The penalty kick was agonizing to the goal-keeper.
sentences.chinese: 点球地守门员来说简直是酷刑。

sentences.english: The Inquisition of the Medieval Ages devised many demoniac means of torture.
sentences.chinese: 中世纪的宗教法庭创造了许多骇人听闻的酷刑。

sentences.english: Though he was tortured to make him change his religion, the prisoner would not recant.
sentences.chinese: 虽然受了酷刑，但那个囚犯绝不改变自己的宗教信仰。

sentences.english: The rack and torture chamber may not be substituted for the witness chair.
sentences.chinese: 不得用酷刑室取代证人席。

definition: the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)

tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
torture/corporal punishment (traditionally involving mutilation or amputation)
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
